alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 12 at 12:14AM MST until August 12 at 8:15AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Yavapai County in west central Arizona... * Until 815 AM MST Saturday. * At 1213 AM MST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.5 and 1.25 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.75 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Camp Verde, Hayfield Draw OHV Area, Bignotti, Aultman, Jordan, Tissaw Trailhead, Middle Verde, Verde Village, Bridgeport, Cornville, Cottonwood, Mormons Crossing Swimming Hole, Cottonwood Airport, Fort Verde State Historic Park and McGuireville. This includes the following highways... State Route 260 between mile markers 207 and 217...and between mile markers 219 and 220. Interstate 17 between mile markers 288 and 289. State Route 89A between mile markers 355 and 358. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Spring Creek, Cherry Creek, Gaddis Wash, Cienega Creek, Grief Hill Wash, Verde River, Oak Creek and Beaver Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
